details.structure: Streamlined schedule with strictly timed slots.

items.title: Welcome & Introduction
items.description: Symposium goals, speaker lineup, and opening remarks by the organizers.

items.title: Flagship Talk I
items.description: A keynote deep-dive by a senior researcher into foundational network science principles.

items.title: Talks, Session A
items.description: Three 20-minute talks focusing on novel applications: Encoding & Representation, Evolution & Adaptation.

items.title: Coffee Break & Networking
items.description: Informal networking break with Complexity Coffee refreshments.

items.title: Flagship Talk II
items.description: A second flagship keynote or a featured panel discussion on the future of interdisciplinary network science.

items.title: Methodological Speed Dating
items.description: Attendees are asked to gather in small groups and discuss their research for a few minutes before rotating to a different group. At the end, participants share their cross-disciplinary takeaways with the whole room.

items.title: Talks, Session B
items.description: Two 20-minute talks focusing on Dynamics & Function, and Foundational Frameworks.

items.title: Closing
items.description: Final remarks and future outlook for the Edge Cases community.

notes: We are also open to running a full day event if we gather the appropriate momentum and a large enough lineup of speakers.
If the volume of high-quality responses to our call for speakers exceeds capacity, we may convert sessions into a 'Lightning Round' (5 or 10-minute talks) or request a Full-day extension.
